title: Request to NASA for all communications with Halle Berry

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications between NASA or employees thereof and the Hollywood film actress Halle Berry, born Maria Halle Berry in Cleveland, Ohio, on August 14, 1966. Such communications may include, but should not be limited to, emails, correspondence, memos, and transcriptions of telephone calls. 

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Request to NASA for list of 2017 film and TV collaborations

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all documentaries, feature films, and TV programs supported by NASA in the year 2017. In a podcast discussion on "Houston We Have a Podcast," billed as "the official podcast of the NASA Johnson Space Center," NASA multimedia liaison Bert Ulrich says, "I think it’s 143 documentaries, 25 feature films and 41 TV programs" that NASA supported in 2017. NASA has previously released such lists of media collaborations, including to this requester, who has made them public. I therefore request the list to which Mr. Ulrich is referring, i.e., of all documentary, feature film, and TV collaborations for the calendar year 2017.

Here is a transcript of the podcast quoted above: https://www.nasa.gov/podcasts/houston-we-have-a-podcast/nasa-in-hollywood/. 

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: DEA support for production of 2024 film "Gunner"

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) and the production of the 2024 movie "Gunner," directed by Dimitri Logothetis and starring Luke Hemsworth. I request any and all documents pertaining to DEA involvement with the production of "Gunner." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of DEA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Gunner," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo
